answers.answer: Hi,Repeated vaginal infections can affect the chances of getting pregnant. Hence the infection should be treated before attempting a pregnancy. Local pessary treatment and systemic antibiotics will help control the infection. Also you should check for diabetes and STD’s. Consult your Doctor. Hope this helps.The answer is based on information provided. Exact advice is not possible without a proper examination and investigations. You are requested to consult your Doctor. Take care and keep us posted.

question: 24 and having reoccurring yeast infections and bacterial vaginosis. Will this effect sperm sufficiently enough to reduce  chances of concieving?
title: do yeast infections effect chances
